Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainController
  • public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
    Refers to the controller class that handles all of the other controller classes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected EventManager eventManager  
      protected MessageManager messageManager  
      protected ReaderWriter RW  
      protected UserManager userManager  
      protected java.lang.String username  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MainController()
      Constructs a MainController object with MessageManager, UserManager, EventManager, ReaderWriter objects, and a String username.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void fileQAllExists()
      This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files.

      This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files.
      void fileQUserMssgRoomsExists()
      This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files.
      int filesExist()
      This method declares three new files for users, messages, and events and returns 0, 1 or 2 based on which files exist.
      void run​(int value)
      This method is responsible for calling the appropriate controller depending on the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainController

        public MainController()
        Constructs a MainController object with MessageManager, UserManager, EventManager, ReaderWriter objects, and a String username.

    • Method Detail

      • filesExist

        public int filesExist()
        This method declares three new files for users, messages, and events and returns 0, 1 or 2 based on which files exist.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if only the users is a file, 1 if users, messages, and events are files, and 2 otherwise.

      • fileQUserMssgExists

        public void fileQUserMssgExists()
        This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files. If the user wants to, they can load all of the pre-existing files, except for events and rooms.

      • fileQUserMssgRoomsExists

        public void fileQUserMssgRoomsExists()
        This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files. If the user wants to, they can load all of the pre-existing files, except for events.

      • fileQAllExists

        public void fileQAllExists()
        This method is responsible for determining whether or not the program will use pre-existing files. If the user wants to, they can load all of the pre-existing files.

      • run

        public void run​(int value)
        This method is responsible for calling the appropriate controller depending on the user. At the end, it saves all the users, messages, events, and rooms to the appropriate files.
        Parameters:
        value - Whether or not to start from scratch
